image.altText: SES rescuers in a dinghy

props.synopsis: A body has been discovered in floodwaters on the Mid North Coast, believed to be that of a man in his 30s who went missing last night. Follow live.

title.children: Two dead, two missing in NSW floodwaters as 50,000 prepare to evacuate

image.altText: Four people smiling and hugging

props.synopsis: Police have confirmed a body, believed to be that of a missing man, has been recovered from floodwaters near Wauchope today. Further south at Moto, residents say they are devastated by the loss of Mr Knowles, whose body was found on Wednesday.

title.children: Second body found in floodwater as tributes flow for 'selfless hero' David Knowles

image.altText: An ambulance and police vehicles line a street where two Israeli embassy staff were shot dead.

props.synopsis: The US secretary of the Department of Homeland Security says the "depraved perpetrator" will be brought to justice.

title.children: Two Israeli embassy staff 'senselessly killed' in Washington DC

image.altText: Bridget McKenzie speaks outside, with two people visible behind her, and a row of trees.

props.synopsis: Nationals senator Bridget McKenzie has accused the Liberals of breach of trust after a letter she wrote to Michaelia Cash was leaked to the media. Follow live.

title.children: Nationals senator accuses Liberals of 'breaching trust' over letter leak

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Breaking: Senior Liberals and Nationals locked in last-minute negotiations to revive Coalition

image.altText: David Littleproud with hands outstretched speaks to press in parliament hallway

props.synopsis: While water devastated regional communities, senior Nationals were in Canberra divvying up the spoils of defeat.

title.children: No love lost between Littleproud and Ley as they seek to reunite Coalition

image.altText: An elderly man walks down the corridor of a secure ward in Sunshine Hospital.

props.synopsis: The TGA has approved a drug found to slow the cognitive decline associated with Alzheimer's disease but it will only be available for a select few who can afford it privately.

title.children: First drug to target cause of Alzheimer's approved for use in Australia

image.altText: Donald Trump frowns.

props.synopsis: Like any smart visitor to the Trump White House, the South African president brought a carefully considered gift and soothing words. But then he made an unorthodox move, and so began the ambush.

title.children: This will be remembered as one of the great ambushes in the White House

image.altText: A digital drawing of Erin Patterson wearing a pink shirt

props.synopsis: Erin Patterson is charged with murdering three relatives by serving them a beef Wellington meal that contained death cap mushrooms. Follow the trial live.

title.children: Erin Patterson told online friends she wanted 'nothing to do with' relatives, court told

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Erin Patterson was researching cancer on phone

image.altText: a cctv image of bondi killer joe cauchi holding a knife inside boni westfield in april 13 2024

props.synopsis: Five experienced psychiatrists were called by the Westfield Bondi Junction inquest to provide their opinions on the treatment of Joel Cauchi's mental health prior to the stabbing attack.

title.children: Bondi killer's 'satanic control' claim 'not taken seriously' by psychiatrist

image.altText: David Littleproud and Sussan Ley during QT

props.synopsis: The Liberals and Nationals have taken their first step towards reconciliation, just two days after their bombshell break-up, with both party leaders delaying planned announcements about their respective frontbench line-ups.

title.children: Two days after bombshell break-up, Liberals and Nationals return to negotiating table

image.altText: A composite image showing about a dozen photos of Norman Swan.

props.synopsis: A fake Norman Swan is spruiking unproven supplements and weight loss products online, and people are falling for it. The real Norman Swan feels powerless to stop it.

title.children: Adele is offering weight loss drugs spruiked by deepfake Norman Swan

image.altText: Intubated and in a coma

props.synopsis: An Australian tourist who was rushed to hospital after drinking a pina colada at a popular Fiji resort says she is convinced she was "poisoned" by tainted alcohol.

title.children: Susan had two sips of a pina colada. Hours later, she was in a coma

image.altText: albanese close up

props.synopsis: Research shows voters want the government to seize the moment after its landslide win and do something big.

title.children: Out of the wreckage on the other side, Albanese has a rare shot

image.altText: A flooded river

props.synopsis: Torrential falls will continue right through Thursday across the already flooded Mid North Coast catchments, with the potential for a fourth consecutive day of totals well above 100 millimetres.

title.children: Flooding rains in NSW to become more widespread, tracking south to Sydney

image.altText: A red chart tracking stocks falling

props.synopsis: The local share market is in the red after US stocks dropped and there was tepid demand for US government bonds, a reflection of investor nerves over Donald Trump's "big, beautiful bill". Follow live.

title.children: ASX follows Wall Street lower as US bond sell-off deepens

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Wesfarmers CEO Rob Scott dodges questions on Bunnings market dominance
Gold rises as funds seeking a 'safe haven' look for alternatives to US Treasury bonds
CFMEU boss Zach Smith steps down

image.altText: Stephanie Case running the Utra-Trail Snowdonia ultramarathon while breastfeeding baby Pepper.

props.synopsis: Six months after giving birth, Stephanie Case returns to trail running with a shock victory in the Snowdonia ultramarathon, breastfeeding daughter Pepper along the mountainous 100km route.

title.children: Human rights lawyer wins 100km ultramarathon while breastfeeding

image.altText: Bruce Lehrmann being filmed as he arrives at the Toowoomba courthouse

props.synopsis: Bruce Lehrmann's lawyers have complained about not receiving evidence during the latest court hearing over an alleged rape in Toowoomba.

title.children: Bruce Lehrmann's lawyers claim 'shroud of secrecy' over rape case

image.altText: A Boeing aircraft flies in the sky

props.synopsis: Retrofitting the 13-year-old plane will require significant security upgrades, communications improvements to prevent spies from listening in and the ability to fend off incoming missiles, experts say.

title.children: US Air Force to spend $1.5 billion retro-fitting gifted Qatari plane for Trump use

image.altText: Ange Postecoglou holds his hand on his chest

props.synopsis: When Spurs hired Ange Postecoglou, he was seen as an alternative to the "winners" who had gone before him. Now he's backed up his pre-season statement of always winning a trophy in his second season to silence the doubters. Again.

title.children: Ange knew he was a 'serial winner' when he went to Spurs. Now they do too

image.altText: Two women with sunglasses in the foreground and a man in the background

props.synopsis: A 24-year-old woman has been sentenced to seven and a half years in prison for setting a friend on fire after a night consuming drugs and alcohol.

title.children: Cheers as woman jailed for setting friend on fire while partying

image.altText: Composite image of Chris Griffin and Laura Henshaw by Morgan

props.synopsis: An Australian podcaster's desire for a partner who does not "complain" about her day and instead offers "peace and love" to support his ambitions has sparked discussions about the resurgence of traditional gender norms.

title.children: Podcaster defends gender comments that sparked outrage from women

props.synopsis: In an emotional speech in parliament and speaking for the first time as an independent, Jimmy Sullivan addresses a recent alleged domestic incident saying it was not violent.

title.children: Expelled Labor MP breaks down in parliament as he defends alleged DV incident

image.altText: A mugshot of Mark-Bry Leedham.

props.synopsis: The family of a murder victim has welcomed a life sentence imposed on one of his killers, while expressing outrage that a different man previously convicted over his death has been moved to a low-security facility.

title.children: Man jailed for at least 28 years over murder 'does not deserve to be in society', victim's family says

image.altText: A photo is displayed on the big screens during Robert Walls Funeral Service at the MCG.

props.synopsis: A decorated player, a ruthless coach and an insightful media performer, Robert Walls is remembered as a "big softie" by his family.

title.children: 'A fortunate life': AFL giant Walls remembered at moving funeral service

image.altText: Man wearing military gear holds gun and stands next to armoured vehicle

props.synopsis: A delegation of diplomats and officials from European, Asian and Arab countries were forced to run when Israeli forces opened fire in the city of Jenin.

title.children: Israeli forces open fire on 25 diplomats including UK, Canada in West Bank tour

image.altText: Carly Findlay sits in a hospital bed. She wears a knitted blue hat with a yellow flower and has a colourful handmade blanket on.

props.synopsis: Carly Findlay knew cancer treatment would be rough. So she made her friends a list.

title.children: The practical gifts that helped me through cancer treatment

image.altText: Band kneecap at a red carpet posing for a photo with one member wearing a ireland flag face pullover

props.synopsis: British police have charged Liam O'Hanna, whose stage name is Mo Chara, with a terrorism offence for allegedly waving a flag in support of Hezbollah at a concert in London.

title.children: UK police charge Kneecap band member with terror offence

image.altText: Workers attempt to fix a broken down train near Strathfield

props.synopsis: The blank signs, "major disruptions" and panic on the platforms, it was an all too familiar scene for Sydney's commuters. So what caused the meltdown?

title.children: The key reason one train problem sent Sydney's network into meltdown

image.altText: Houses under construction on a bright, sunny day

props.synopsis: Lord Mayor Adrian Schrinner says car parking requirements, building heights, lot sizes and "red tape reduction" will form part of the review.

title.children: Brisbane council announces review into low-to-medium density housing

image.altText: The ACT Supreme Court (good generic). (22 April 2016)

props.synopsis: A 29-year-old man has been sentenced to more than nine years in jail after he admitted to drugging two people and sexually assaulting them.

title.children: Canberra man jailed for drugging, sexually assaulting, filming two people

props.synopsis: Interest rates are falling, inflation is down and the Reserve Bank seems happier than it’s been in ages. So, have we achieved the so-called soft landing after all the economic turmoil we’ve suffered since the pandemic?

title.children: The Trump cloud hanging over the RBA
